page.title: 12THE LIFE OF A VICAR.
page.content: Mr. Tudor Jones has been the vicar of this Parish for six years. He has four Anglican Churches. They are Llangiwg (named after Saint Ciwg who lived in the sixth century), St. Mary's at Ynysmeudwy, St. Peter's (often called the 'Cathedral of the valley') and All Saints Church. All Saints Church is particularly interesting. It is not an old church. It is only one hundred years old. It was built by a wealthy landowner in the district as a private church - his name was Gillbertson and he and his family owned several large houses in the area. Today All Saints Church is unusual. It is used by people both of the Anglican and the Catholic faith. They have agreed to share the costs of the running and upkeep of the church.
